title: Are previous year JEE questions enough for JEE? - Quora

response.answer_text: Previous years JEE questionnaires are enough to understand the pattern of the examination and question styles. But you will hardly find questions repeating from last year but saying that the theme of the question can be repeated. Check the model questions which available in the market. Solving them will give you confidence also you should try to solve the previous years question pattern which will give you a feeling how you would have performed you would appeared that year in JEE :) Best of the luck for your upcoming JEE

Enough means what? if you are only preparing past year questions then my friend no these are not enough. These are not enough for cracking the exam. you have to be clear with each and every topic and should have practiced a lot then only you can crack the exam. but, if you are done with your entire preparation and using past years just to know the pattern and type of question than my friend you are on the safe boat.

Concept matters the most….and the best way to build your concepts is through questions…aslo u learn different things from questions and their solutions which u dont notice in theory part ….so if u can solve previous year QUESTIONS without any doubt and without seeing the solution …then u have already excelled the chapter….then u can leave other questions….but its rare that without solving any question and directly attacking PYQ ….

There is nothing enough. If you are thinking that by solving previous year questions only enough is not right. You have to solve more questions and repeatedly. So follow a book and solve all the questions of that book and repeat. I will suggest you to follow Arihant or Cengage.

Not at all,you can just have a look on them in penultimate days to exam and if you have not prepared thus far try to concentrate on formuales and solving one sum of each kind. PS:formuales are must along applications.
